FacilityName: Linn Cooperative Oil Co.- Marion Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:
  This facility complies with OSHA (29 CFR 1910.111) requirements for Anhydrous Ammonia 
storage and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws. If an emergency
were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Marion Fire Dept. and the Linn Co. LEPC, and request
that they respond to our emergency.

Facilty description and regulated substance handled:
   This facility is a farm fertilizer plant. We sell and apply Anhyrous Ammonia fertilizer. The plant
consists of one storage tank (26,000 gal.) and associated piping, compressor pump,valves, nurse tanks,
and other miscellaneous equipment.

General accidental release program and chemical specific prevention steps:
   This facility complies with the EPA's accident prevention rule as well as all applicable local and 
state codes and regulations. This Anhydrous Ammonia plant is designed, built and maintained according
to OSHA (29 CFR 1910.111) and state regulations. Our employees are trained regularly in Anhydrous Ammonia
and plant operation safety.

Five year accident history:
   No accidents involving NH3 that caused death, injuries, environmental or property damage, or evacuations.

Emergency response program:
   It is our policy that in the event of an emergency involving NH3, the Marion Fire Dept. and the Linn County
LEPC be notified and requested to respond to the emergency. We have discussed this with the Fire Dept. and
the LEPC.  The Fire Dept. has a copy of our Emergency Action Plan and also inspects our facility on a yearly
basis. The county LEPC was briefed on plant operations and procedures during their Feb.2001 meeting by Linn Coop.

Planned changes to improve safety:
  None at this time. Continue safety training , inspections and maintenance.
